Node Group Description: Nodes for managing your AWS S3 Bucket storage.

Node Group Description: Enrich people data using Apollo.io

Retrieve a list of transcripts you created.
Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.

Node 10 description: Uploads a file to BuildShip's in-built Google Cloud Storage Bucket and returns the public URL

Node Group Description: Nodes to interact with other BuildShip Workflows

Node Group Description: Document processing with Document AI
Node 1 description:
Form Parser allows you to automatically extract fields, values, and generic entities like names, addresses, and prices from standard forms, structuring data in tables. It's ready to use without the need for training or customization, suitable for various document types.
**To use this node you must first enable the 
[Document AI API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/documentai.googleapis.com?project=_)**
Node 2 description:
Extract text and values from invoices such as invoice number, supplier name, invoice amount, tax amount, invoice date, due date.
**To use this node you must first enable the 
[Document AI API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/documentai.googleapis.com?project=_)**
Node 3 description:
Identify and extract text in different types of documents. This processor allows you to identify and extract text, including handwritten text, from documents in over 200 language.
**To use this node you must first enable the 
[Document AI API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/documentai.googleapis.com?project=_)**
Node 4 description:
Extract fields from US Driver License, including names, dates, etc.
**To use this node you must first enable the 
[Document AI API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/documentai.googleapis.com?project=_)**

Node Group Description: Nodes for utilizing ElevenLabs Text to Speech capabilities in your workflow
Node 1 description:
Converts a stream of text to a stream of speech using ElevenLabs API.

The speech stream is mp3 encoded.
Node 2 description: Converts text to speech using ElevenLabs API and returns the Base64 encoded audio buffer data
Node 3 description: Converts text to speech using ElevenLabs API and saves the output to as a file on BuildShip Storage and gives a publically accessible URL.

Node Group Description: Nodes for working with FFmpeg for video and audio processing.
Node 1 description: Overlay audio on top of an existing video using FFmpeg.
Node 2 description: Combine multiple audio files into one.
Node 3 description: Combine multiple videos into one, ensuring they all share a common resolution.

Node 5 description: Compresses a video file using FFmpeg
Node 6 description: Converts the specified video from one format to another. NOTE: This process can be compute intensive depending on the size of the video.

Node 5 description: Fetch user data from Firebase Auth based given their user ID

Node 7 description: Checks if a firebase user already exists for the given email

Node 7 description: Create a pull request on GitHub using Octokit
Node 8 description: Create a new pull request on Github
Node 9 description: Fetches commits and pull requests merged since the last release using Octokit
Node 10 description: Fetches a GitHub user by username

Node 13 description: Fetches a specific issue from a GitHub repository
Node 14 description: Fetches the existing labels in a Github repository using Octokit
Node 15 description: Fetches labels of a GitHub repository
Node 16 description: Fetches a GitHub user by username

Converts speech to text using Google Cloud Speech-to-Text API.

Node Group Description: Nodes for performing actions using the Google Maps API provided by Google.
Node 1 description:
Calculate the distance between two addresses using Google's Directions API. **To use this node you must first enable the 
[Directions API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/directions-backend.googleapis.com?project=_)**
Node 2 description:
Geocode address using Google's Geocoding API. 

**To use this node you must first enable the 
 [Geocoding API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/geocoding-backend.googleapis.com?project=_)**

Get nearby places using Google's Places API.

Node Group Description: OAuth Nodes for utilizing the GSearch Console API to retrieve and perform operations based on your Google Search Account.
Node 1 description: Gets the Site Metadata from the Google Search Console for a given site URL.
Node 2 description: Indexes the given site url to the Google Search Console.

Node Group Description: OAuth Nodes for utilizing the Google Sheets API to perform operations on your Google Sheets Document.
Node 1 description: Adds row(s) of data in a Google Sheet.
Node 2 description: Batch updates values in a Google Sheet. This node is technically a bit complex to entertain more versatile use cases. To simply add values to a Google Sheet, check out the "Add Row" node.
Node 3 description: Creates a new Google Spreadsheet.
Node 4 description: Fetch a Google Spreadsheet using the Google Sheets API

Node Group Description: Nodes for utilizing the Google Translate API to perform language based translations.
Node 1 description: Validates if the given language code is a valid ISO 639-1 language code
Node 2 description:
Translate text to a specified language using Google Translate API.  
___
**You must first [enable the Translation API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/translate.googleapis.com?project=_&supportedpurview=project) to use this node.**

Node Group Description: Nodes for leveraging Groq's super-fast LPU Inference Engine.
Node 1 description: Groq AI Assistant node for building chatbot and AI workflows that can run fast. Connect to your datasources and perform function calling.
Node 2 description: Using the Groq (LLM) Chat Completions API that processes messages and generates output responses.
Node 3 description: Using the Groq API to convert speech to text. Converts File or Buffer into Text / JSON output. Uses Whisper Large V3 by default.

Node Group Description: Nodes with Hugging Face's popular models.
Node 1 description: Generate caption for the image using Hugging Face's [Salesforce/blip-image-captioning-large](https://huggingface.co/Salesforce/blip-image-captioning-large) model for image captioning pretrained on COCO dataset - base architecture (with ViT large backbone).
Node 2 description: Get classification labels for your image using Hugging Face's [google/vit-base-patch16-224](https://huggingface.co/google/vit-base-patch16-224) model which is a transformer encoder model (BERT-like) pretrained on a large collection of images in a supervised fashion, namely ImageNet-21k, at a resolution of 224x224 pixels. Next, the model was fine-tuned on ImageNet (also referred to as ILSVRC2012), a dataset comprising 1 million images and 1,000 classes, also at resolution 224x224.
Node 3 description: Summarize long text using Hugging Face's [facebook/bart-large-cnn](https://huggingface.co/facebook/bart-large-cnn) model which is a transformer encoder-encoder (seq2seq) model with a bidirectional (BERT-like) encoder and an autoregressive (GPT-like) decoder. BART is pre-trained by (1) corrupting text with an arbitrary noising function, and (2) learning a model to reconstruct the original text.
Node 4 description: Generate image from text, using Hugging Face's [openskyml/dalle-3-xl](https://huggingface.co/openskyml/dalle-3-xl) test model very similar to Dall•E 3.
Node 5 description: Generate music from text using Hugging Face's [facebook/musicgen-small](https://huggingface.co/facebook/musicgen-small) model capable of generating high-quality music samples conditioned on text descriptions or audio prompts.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with the Hume AI APIs
Node 1 description: Start a new job with the Expression Measurement API.
Node 2 description: Get the JSON predictions of a completed measurement

Node Group Description: JSON validation and transformation
Node 1 description: Appends an array of objects to a JSON file. If the file or folder path doesn't exist, it creates it
Node 2 description: Extracts and concatenates specific property values from an array within a JSON object and returns the concatenated string.
Node 3 description: Extracts a specific key from each object within the array and concatenates the values into a single string.
Node 4 description: Check if a given string is valid JSON
Node 5 description: Creates a CSV file from an array of JSON objects, stores it in the GCP Storage Bucket, and returns the public download URL.
Node 6 description: Converts a JSON string back into a JavaScript object
Node 7 description: Convert a JSON object to a string

Node Group Description: Connecting with your Lemon Squeezy accounts and webhooks.
Node 1 description: Connect with your LemonSqueezy account and activates a workflow in response to specific webhook events.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with and using your Leonardo AI services and models.
Node 1 description: This endpoint generates images with the given generation prompt and returns the Generation ID.
Node 2 description: This endpoint returns a random image generation prompt.
Node 3 description: This endpoint returns an improved image generation prompt.
Node 4 description:
This endpoint uploads the given file buffer to the signed URL provided by the  **Upload Init Image** node.

Detailed instructions for using this endpoint are available in the guide: [How to upload an image using a presigned URL](https://docs.leonardo.ai/docs/how-to-upload-an-image-using-a-presigned-url).
Node 5 description: This endpoint returns a random image generation prompt. Detailed instructions for using this endpoint are available in the guide: [How to upload an image using a presigned URL](https://docs.leonardo.ai/docs/how-to-upload-an-image-using-a-presigned-url).

Node Group Description: Nodes for performing operations on Linear
Node 1 description: Create an issue in Linear using the provided API key, title and description.
Node 2 description: Fetch all issues from Linear that match a given project name

Node Group Description: Nodes that interact with Loops. Loops is an email platform, that helps you send marketing and transactional emails
Node 1 description: Create a new contact with an email address and any other contact properties.
Node 2 description: Delete a contact by email address or user ID.
Node 3 description: Find a contact by email address or user ID.
Node 4 description: Send events to trigger emails in Loops.
Node 5 description: Send a transactional email to a contact.
Node 6 description: Update or create a contact on your Loops account

Node Group Description: Nodes to Mailchimp's features into BuildShip workflows.
Node 1 description: Add a subscriber email to a Mailchimp List.

Node Group Description: Nodes for publishing blog content to Medium.
Node 1 description: Publishes a blog post to Medium.

Node Group Description: Nodes to utilize the Meilisearch functionality.
Node 1 description: Add a single document to MeiliSearch. Accepts a JSON object representing the document and adds it to the index
Node 2 description: Add a list of documents to MeiliSearch index.
Node 3 description: Delete a document from a Meilisearch index.
Node 4 description: Performs a full text search on a Meilisearch index
Node 5 description: Retrieve a document from a Meilisearch index using the given Document ID.
Node 6 description: Performs a hybrid search combining full-text and attribute-based filtering, returning a JSON object or an array of them. For more details on using vector search in MeiliSearch, visit the [official documentation](https://www.meilisearch.com/docs/learn/experimental/vector_search#using-vector-search).
Node 7 description: Update a single document in MeiliSearch. Accepts a JSON object representing the document and updates it.
Node 8 description: Update multiple documents in MeiliSearch by sending an array of JSON objects.
Node 9 description: Update the synonyms for any index in your MeiliSearch instance

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with Meta apps and services
Nodes for interacting with and performing operations on the MongoDB database.
Node 1 description:
Trigger a workflow on data changes in your MongoDB database. Parse the incoming data payload from MongoDB and create a workflow connected to other apps. 

Check out the [Full Documentation](https://docs.buildship.com/trigger-nodes/mongodb-trigger) on how connect to your MongoDB project.
Node 2 description: Deletes a document from a specified collection in MongoDB by document ID and returns the operation response.
Node 3 description: Fetches and returns the entire document data from a MongoDB collection based on the given document ID.
Node 4 description:
This performs a full-text search in a specified MongoDB collection,  conducts the search, returns matched documents.

To enable full-text search (FTS) in MongoDB, follow this [guide](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/mongodb-search#full-text-search) on setting up MongoDB Search Index.
Node 5 description:
This performs a hybrid search in a specified MongoDB collection,  conducts the search, returns matched documents.

To enable semantic search in MongoDB, follow this [guide](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/mongodb-search#hybrid-search) on setting up search indexes.
Node 6 description: Inserts the given data into a MongoDB collection and returns the ids of the inserted documents.
Node 7 description: Queries for multiple documents in a MongoDB collection using connection string, database name, collection name, query, sort, and projection.
Node 8 description:
This performs a semantic search in a specified MongoDB collection,  conducts the search, returns matched documents.

To enable semantic search in MongoDB, follow this [guide](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/mongodb-search#semantic-search) on setting up vector search index.
Node 9 description: Updates a specific document in a MongoDB collection using the updateOne function and returns the operation result.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with your hosted MySQL Database.
Node 1 description: Deletes row(s) from a MySQL table based on a filter
Node 2 description: Inserts a row into a MySQL database table
Node 3 description: Perform Select query from a MySQL table
Node 4 description: Executes an SQL query on a specified database
Node 5 description: Updates row(s) in a MySQL table based on a filter.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with your Notion Workspace
Node 1 description: A block object represents a piece of content within Notion. The API translates the headings, toggles, paragraphs, lists, media, and more that you can interact with in the Notion UI as different block type objects. (https://developers.notion.com/reference/block)
Node 2 description: Creates a comment in a page or existing discussion thread.
Node 3 description: Creates an access token for third-party service authentication with Notion
Node 4 description: Creates a new page that is a child of an existing page or database using OAuth
Node 5: Creates a database as a subpage
Node 5 description: Creates a database as a subpage in the specified parent page, with the specified properties schema. Currently, the parent of a new database must be a Notion page or a wiki database.
Node 6 description: Retrieve a Notion page using OAuth.
Node 7 description: A block object represents a piece of content within Notion. The API translates the headings, toggles, paragraphs, lists, media, and more that you can interact with in the Notion UI as different block type objects. (https://developers.notion.com/reference/block)
Node 8 description: Lists all users in a Notion workspace
Node 9 description: Gets a list of Pages and/or Databases contained in the database, filtered and ordered according to the filter conditions and sort criteria provided in the request using OAuth
Node 10 description: Retrieves a list of un-resolved Comment objects from a page or block via OAuth
Node 11 description: Retrieves a database object — information that describes the structure and columns of a database — for a provided database ID.
Node 12 description: Performs a search on Notion for a given title through all the parent and child pages using OAuth
Node 13 description: Updates the content for the specified `block_id` based on the block type.. Official Documentation - [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/update-a-block)
Node 14 description: Updates Notion database. Retrieves a database object — information that describes the structure and columns of a database via OAuth
Node 15 description: Updates the properties of a page in a database. Official Documentation - [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/patch-page)

Node Group Description: Nodes for build applications with blockchain micro-transactions, missions, rewards, rankings and leaderboards.
Node 1 description: Checks whether the user has completed all of the actions that make up a mission, and whether they have already been rewarded for completing the mission. [Full Documentation Here](https://docs.openformat.tech/no-code/buildship/nodes/check-missions)
Node 2 description: Creates a web3 account for your user. You can learn more about what this is and how it benefits your users here.
Node 3 description: Returns a leaderboard based on the amount of experience points (XP) users have earned.
Node 4 description: Returns the user's experience point (XP) balance, the badges they have collected and the actions they have completed within that specific dApp.
Node 5 description: Reward a user with a badge for completing an action or mission. [Full documentation here](https://docs.openformat.tech/no-code/buildship/nodes/reward-badge)
Node 6 description: Reward a user with experience points (XP) for completing an action.

Node Group Description: Open AI Models
Node 1 description: Generates a readable stream for a file stored in OpenAI Storage. Return this stream using a 'Return' node to receive it through an API endpoint (to download the file, write it to the file system, etc.)
Node 2 description: Generate embeddings for a given content using OpenAI text-embedding-ada-002 model
Node 3 description: Use GPT-4 Vision to ask questions about images.
Node 4 description: Converts text to Base64 image using OpenAI's DALL·E models.
Node 5 description: Generates text based on a given user and system prompt and always returns a JSON object using the OpenAI GPT (Turbo) APIs.
Node 6 description: Extract structured data from any text input.
Node 7 description: Extract structured data from any web page.
Node 8 description: Analyses multiple images using the OpenAI GPT-4 Vision model.
Node 9 description: Find the nearest neighbors for a given search query using OpenAI embeddings
Node 10 description: Add different script nodes and let the AI Assistant automatically choose which to execute based on the input. Built to work with OpenAI Assistants API V2.
Node 11 description: Add different script nodes and let the AI Assistant automatically choose which to execute based on the input. The node returns a streamed text response (meant to be returned back to the client) and the thread ID (to track the conversation). Built to work with OpenAI Assistants API.
Node 12 description:
Send a chat message to OpenAI and return the response stream.

---

If you plan on sending this stream back to the client as the response, you may want to consider adding a **Set Response Header** node following this node (and before the return node) with the key set to `content-type` and the value set to `text/plain`, to make it easier for the client to figure out how to handle the stream.
Node 13 description: Generates text using OpenAI API for a given user and system prompt
Node 14 description: Converts text to speech using OpenAI API and returns audio in Base64.
Node 15 description: Convert audio/speech to text using OpenAI's Whisper API.

Node Group Description: Nodes to leverage Perplexity AI's blazingly fast LLM inference.
Node 1 description: Sends a question to Perplexity's AI models and generates a response for the given chat conversation.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with the Pinecone vector database
Node 1 description: Deletes vectors by their id from a specified namespace
Node 2 description: Queries vectors in the Pinecone database index
Node 3 description: Creates a new Pinecone index if it does not already exist and upserts the given record.

Node 2 description: Fetch data from a Postgres DB

Node Group Description: replicate.com hosted open source models

This trigger verifies if the API call if from an authenticated Rowy project, runs the workflow and returns the body data. [Full documentation](https://docs.buildship.com/trigger-nodes/rowy-trigger)

Node Group Description: Nodes for sending emails via Sendgrid
Node 1 description: Sends a dynamic email using the Sendgrid API with tracking and a specified template (NOTE: The messages sent via SendGrid might end up in spam if you haven't verified your sendgrid account)

Node Group Description: Nodes for connecting with your Supabase tables and perform actions on your data.

Node Group Description: Nodes for interacting with the Tavily Search API
Node 1 description:
Tavily Search is a robust search API tailored specifically for LLM Agents. It seamlessly integrates with diverse data sources to ensure a superior, relevant search experience.

[More information and API here](https://docs.tavily.com/docs/tavily-api/introduction)




Features​:
- Curated Results: Provides top-tier results sorted by relevance across multiple sources.
- Speed & Efficiency: Optimized for performance, delivering real-time results.
- Customizable: Easily refine search results based on various criteria.
- Easy Integration: Simple to integrate with existing applications.

Node Group Description: Nodes for integrating Telegram functionality within your Workflow.

Node 2 description: Send an audio file to a Telegram chat using the sendAudio API endpoint. Supports .MP3 and .M4A formats. Maximum file size is 50 MB.
Node 3 description: Sends a message to a Telegram chat via the Telegram Bot API
